definition: to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet
to brush/to paint/to daub/to paste up/to skip class (of students)/to fire from a job

sentences.english: The top photo shows the wiper motor being hooked up.
sentences.chinese: 最高的照片顯示，雨刷電機正在連接。

sentences.english: The wipers wiped from the center of the windshield out, leaving a big unwiped V in the middle.
sentences.chinese: 雨刷從擋風玻璃中心劃出，劃出一個大大的V字型。

sentences.english: The other engineers welcomed him aboard Ford’s wiper team.
sentences.chinese: 其他的工程師也邀請卡恩斯加入雨刷小組。

sentences.english: After his breakdown over the Mercedes wiper, he was unable to work.
sentences.chinese: 由於水星雨刷，卡恩斯陷入了崩潰，而不能工作。

sentences.english: How is your new motor behaving?
sentences.chinese: 雨刷馬達在低速運轉嗎？

sentences.english: One of the guards said, “That’s the man who invented the intermittent windshield wiper.”
sentences.chinese: 一個保安說，“他就是發明間歇性雨刷的人。”

sentences.english: In fact one of the wiper blades began to flap off.
sentences.chinese: 事實上有一片雨刷的刮片已經決定自己振翅高飛了。

sentences.english: Altogether, about thirty million intermittent wipers are sold around the world each year.
sentences.chinese: 每年，間歇性雨刷在全球的銷售總量約爲3千萬件。

sentences.english: The Windshield Wiper is serving a four-year sentence.
He was the sort of man Kearns imagined himself becoming. Kearns brought Tann out to the car and showed him the intermittent wiper.
sentences.chinese: 卡恩斯向坦恩展示他的間歇性雨刷。

sentences.english: The idea for the intermittent windshield wiper entered his mind.
sentences.chinese: 於是，他想到發明間歇性雨刷。

sentences.english: The standard wiper was driven by intake from the engine manifold, which was connected by a series of hoses to the wiper motor.
sentences.chinese: 標準雨刷是由發動機歧管內部驅動。

sentences.english: He says he simply wants to make windshield wipers.
sentences.chinese: 他說他只是想生產擋風玻璃雨刷。

sentences.english: Of course, one of the things we worked on was the intermittent wiper.
sentences.chinese: 間歇式雨刷也是當時我們研發項目之一。

definition: car window/window of vehicle (bus, train etc)
reflector (typically concave, as in a torch)/mirror (typically plane or convex)
to brake (when driving)/to stop/to switch off/to check (bad habits)/a brake
to drive a vehicle/movement of vehicles
